summary: The document outlines conflict management procedures for a committee, detailing how members should handle potential conflicts of interest. It specifies the roles of the Chairperson and Secretary in managing meetings and decision-making processes, including quorum requirements and documentation responsibilities.
keyFacts: The document discusses conflict management procedures for committee members.
It specifies that members must notify the Chairperson of any potential conflicts of interest.
The Chairperson has the authority to decide on the participation of conflicted members in meetings.
A Secretary is appointed to manage meeting logistics and documentation.
Decisions require the presence of the Chairperson and at least 50% of Voting Members.
